definition: closing date (of contract)/maturity (of an investment bond)
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)
a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

sentences.english: Time deposits generally have a predetermined maturity and amount.
sentences.chinese: 定期存款通常具有预先规定的到期日和数额。

sentences.english: Payment made before mid- night on the due date will be regarded as on- time payment.
sentences.chinese: 于到期日午夜前缴款会被视作准时缴交。

sentences.english: What shall we do if a customer doesn't pay up on the due date?
sentences.chinese: 如果客户不在交款到期日付款，我们怎么办？

sentences.english: A type of option or warrant which allows the holder to exercise only on the expiry date.
sentences.chinese: 一种只允许持有者在到期日行权的期权或权证。

sentences.english: The future date is called the delivery date or final settlement date.
sentences.chinese: 未来的日期也叫交割日或到期日。

sentences.english: Funding costs are gradually reduced over time as the CBBC moves towards expiry.
sentences.chinese: 融资成本会随牛熊证接近到期日而逐渐减少。

definition: to fall due (loan etc)/to expire (visa etc)/to mature (investment bond etc)
one year period (in a contract or budget)
